label: 26931/ZW4006
info_overview: The switch enables wireless control of On/OFF functions of incandescent, LED, xenon, halogen and fluorescent lighting. Not only does it act as a switch but the GE In-Wall Smart Motion Switch has a built in PIR sensor which can control the local and be set in occupancy or vacancy mode.
info_inclusion:
1. Follow the instructions for your Z-Wave certified controller to include the smart switch to the Z-Wave network.
  2. Once the controller is ready to include your smart switch, press and release the top or bottom button on the smart switch to include it in the network.
info_exclusion:
1. Follow the instructions for your Z-Wave certified controller to exclude a device from the Z-Wave network.
  2. 2. Once the controller is ready to exclude your device, press and release the top or bottom button on the smart switch to exclude it from the network.
category_description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Timeout Duration
parameters.description: Amount of time the light stays on after motion stops

parameters.label: Dim level
parameters.description: Change brightness of associated light bulb(s)

parameters.label: Invert Switch
parameters.description: In a 3-way configuration, invert the connected Add-On Switch buttons

parameters.label: Motion Sensor Sensitivity
parameters.description: Amount of motion required to turn on the light

parameters.label: Light Sensing
parameters.description: Enable/Disable whether motion sensor only turns light on if room is dark

associations.label: Basic Set Local Load
associations.description: Supports Basic Set and is controlled with the local load

associations.label: Basic Set Buttons
associations.description: Supports Basic Set and is controlled by pressing the On or Off buttons

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.

channels.name: config_decimal
channels.label: Operation Mode
channels.overview:
Sets how the light responds to motion

 

1=Manual, 2=Vacancy, 3=Occupancy
